channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Noisy metal cover, 8th November
item.description:
Reported this several weeks ago. Totally unfair to residents…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Mortimer Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden waste bins filled with household rubbish, 8th November
item.description:
Outside 115-117 Foulden Road there is a lot of rubbish that remains uncleared. It is stuffed into the garden waste bins or placed around them. There is often a lot of litter around the bins too. It has been like this for several months now, getting worse

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement sunk below road level, 8th November
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem that has not been resolved. The pavement has sunk below the level of the roadbed level leaving protruding kerbstones, broken pavement, dip in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Askern Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area in complete darkness, 8th November
item.description:
All lighting is out on both sides of the A bridge. This is the only pedestrian route to north Thamesmead. It feels very unsafe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car with no MOT, 8th November
item.description:
This is the third vehicle left in or opposite Matfield Close in a month. Both previous abandoned untaxed vans have finally been removed We now have a car abandoned that has no MOT We have insufficient parking spaces as it is as many houses have no drives. Please can you investigate V v frustrating

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Matfield Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 8th November
item.description:
Romanians are gathering for drinks late at night, discarding sunflower seeds on the floor as well as alcohol bottles and nitrous gas. There is also an abandoned stainless steel unit

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rippolson Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs pruning, 8th November
item.description:
The tree in the street outside 57 and 59 Elmstead Avenue needs significant pruning. Each year it drops hundreds of crab apples onto the pavement (a trip hazard) and it's up to the residents to clear up the mess. I myself have spent many hours doing this. The problem gets worse each year as the tree grows bigger! Thanks in advance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contaminated bins AGAIN, 8th November
item.description:
Recycling bins are being used for fly tipping again. They then cannot be collected each week by the refuse collectors, making it a vicious circle of tipping, overflowing bins and no collection. Please remove the recycling bins to prevent this from reoccuring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2B, Combedale Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lamp not working, 8th November
item.description:
Street light not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakham Drive, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Callcott Road, London

item.title: Fly Tipping, 8th November
item.description:
There is a constant dumping of rubbish around the commercial bins every day. Clearing it up once in a while is not the solution. Since moving the location from outside the shops it has become a persistent problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street and on Planters, 8th November
item.description:
There are food packaging, cans and bottles on the planters and pavements located on Tabard Street. This has been over a WEEK Despite fixmystreet stating it has been cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bagged Rubbish, 8th November
item.description:
You’ve no sooner collected the bags of rubbish dumped outside the Air B&B at 27 Cato St and they’ve dumped a load more!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Cato Street, Marylebone, London

item.title: Saturday, 8th November
item.description:
It starts like this. One person drops their things, which then gives other people permission. “Everyone is doing it.”

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Forgotten roadworks barriers, 8th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Eden Park, London

item.title: Filter light turned 90 degrees, 8th November
item.description:
